extendedInfo.description: The title combines  puzzle dynamics  with those of a rhythm-game. It has been designed to be the definitive pastime.The game is set in a classic Japanese Zen garden and is based on the concepts of Order and Chaos.In the heart of the garden there is a maple tree around which are located 5 stones with 5 different colored symbols to which correspond âmana stonesâ falling from the tree.The player's task is to match symbols and colors in order to promote Order and Harmony, flowing trough an infinite series of standard and bonus levels.FEATURES:High quality 3d Graphics	Push your device to the max with fully 3d graphics and dynamic environments.Intuitive Controls: It can be played with just one finger.Addictive Gameplay: Challenge yourself and others to get the best score on infinite game levels.Funny Bonus Levels:	Five different bonus levels to achieve more points and much more fun.Charming Soundtrack:	Live a totally immersive experience with zen music and sounds that change together with graphics and mood.Social Features:	Share your results and challenge your Facebook friends.

reviews.title: Correction: Anxiety Training
reviews.comment: There is nothing Zen about this puzzle-rhythm game from the talented Crescent Moon Games.  Spin a beautifully illustrated tree to catch the correct color stones before they hit the ground. Sounds easy.  The game starts out peaceful and serene, but soon the number and frequency of stones increase, as does your blood-pressure.  Some mini-games break up the pace and the game is increasingly challenging and incredibly addictive. Fun for a few minutes or a few hours. Playtime 4.5 hours. Thanks.
reviews.author: Mark Toutant

reviews.title: Dizzy
reviews.comment: Although it is a neat little game I couldn\'t play long because it made me so dizzy. Overall a fun concept it just isnt very practical.
reviews.author: alison gossett

reviews.title: Tedious Gameplay
reviews.comment: I do not know what the attraction is for this game. I found it to become a tedious bore as you simply rotated the tree to align like colored stones. It got old.
reviews.author: John Sokolowski

reviews.title: Decent.
reviews.comment: Worth the cost for a time killer game.
reviews.author: Matthew Johnson

reviews.comment: Smooth gameplay, nice graphics. Simple and relaxing game...
reviews.author: Jonathan Hadley
